Sequence Information.Peptide Name: BM-CATH (cathelicidin, natural AMPs; mammals, animals, UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (75.86%) toLV-CATHR: 21%, I=G: 17%, K: 10%. GRAVY: -0.376; Mol Wt: 3373.105; mol formula: C156H260N53O31; mol ex coeff: 5550.Activity: active against E. coli 11 isolates (MIC 8-64 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa 10 strains (MIC 8-16 ug/ml), A. baumannii 9 strains (MIC 8-16 ug/ml), and K. pneumoniae 7 isolates (MIC 8-64 ug/ml).In vitro toxicity: sheep RBC, less than 20% hemolysis at 512 ug/ml: poor hemo.lytic.Structure:  random coil in water and helical in 25 mM SDS.
Literature Information.Author: Wang J, Zhang M, Li C, Liu M, Qi Y, Xie X, Zhou C, Ma L. 2024
Literature Information.Reference: Comput Struct Biotechnol J. 2024 May 17;23:2388-2406. doi: 10.1016/j.csbj.2024.05.020.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: A novel cathelicidin TS-CATH derived from Thamnophis sirtalis combats drug-resistant gram-negative bacteria in vitro and in vivo.
